results.title: American splendor
results.creator_credit: Shari Springer Berman, Robert Pulcini, Ted Hope, Fine Line Features and Home Box Office
results.brief_description: The life and times of American comic book writer Harvey Pekar - meet the real man, and the actor playing him (Paul Giamatti), in a movie about his “ordinary life”. Based on Harvey’s comic book “American Splendor” written by Harvey and illustrated by R.Crumb, he details the mundanities of ordinary life in such a way that makes for a great commentary on working class life in everyday America. The film covers the period of Harvey’s life when he gets divorced, looses his voice and compulsively collects old jazz records, to the time when he meets his new wife (Hope Davis), goes on the “Letterman” show to promote the comic, gets cancer and goes on to be part of this film. Cleverly realised we traverse his life via comics and actors, as well as interjections from the real Harvey, making an “ordinary life” quite compelling viewing.

results.title: The Man without a past
results.creator_credit: Aki Kaurismaki, Sputnik Oy, Pyramide Productions and Pandora Films
results.brief_description: Typically quirky feature from Finnish director Aki Kaurismaki about a man, M, who travels to Helsinki, is brutally bashed, and loses his identity after suffering from amnesia. Knowing nothing about his past, M is adopted by a community of vagrants, living in shipping containers on the wharf. Despite the harsh conditions, the residents find enough food and shelter to keep them comfortable and even participate in festive evenings. M fits nicely into his new environs, eventually meeting a young woman with whom romance blossoms. Utilising his signature dark humour Kaurismaki explores the idea that happiness is what you make of life in this relatively upbeat, humanistic and wry work.

results.title: The City of lost children [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jean-Pierre Jeunet, Marc Caro, Claudie Ossard, France 3 Cinema, Studio Canal+ and Lumière
results.brief_description: An extraordinary film from the makers of “Delicatessen”. Krank lives on a lonely oil rig in a swirling sea. He cannot dream and is aging prematurely so he kidnaps young children hoping to steal their sleeping thoughts. On a quest to find his young brother, a fairground strongman called One sets off on a series of fantastical adventures to rescue the lost children.

results.title: Mississippi masala [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Mira Nair, Michael Nozik, Film Four International and SCS Films
results.brief_description: A refreshingly tender film about race relations in the United States that manages to be both intelligent and complex. Mina (Roshan Seth) is an Indian woman whose family fled Uganda during the rule of Idi Amin. She falls in love with Demetrius (Denzel Washington), an African-American who is challenged by the traditions of her Indian background. She in turn has to fight against her family’s fears and racism. Without histrionics this film paints a picture of small-town Americana that is rich and diverse. A wonderful comic love story with excellent performances.

results.title: Year of the Horse: Neil Young and Crazy Horse live
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, L Johnson and Shakey Pictures
results.brief_description: Spanning a career of more that three decades, legendary performer Neil Young and his band Crazy Horse ‘crank it up’ in rockin’ live concert documentary footage of an extensive tour in 1996. Watch interviews with the band: guitarist Frank “Poncho” Sampedro, bassist Billy Talbot, drummer Ralph Molina and singer/guitarist Neil Young. Mixed with intimate back-stage and ‘on-the-road’ moments from the 1970s through to the 1990s, director Jim Jarmusch takes the viewer on a musical pilgrimage discovering the intensity of live performance and staying-power of these classic rock compositions by Young and the Horse. Shot on Super8, 16mm and Hi-8 Video.

results.title: The Tigger movie [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jun Falkenstein, Cheryl Abood and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: When no-one will play with him Tigger sets out on a journey to find his family tree, and other Tiggers. This is harder than he thought and he quickly becomes discouraged. When his friends Winnie the Pooh, Eeyore, Owl, Kanga and Roo see that their friend is sad, they pretend to be the family he wishes for, by writing him a letter and dressing up as Tiggers. But when Tigger finds out who they really are, he becomes more determined to find his real family, and wanders out into a snowstorm. Roo, upset that he has lost his best friend, convinces the others to follow Tigger and show him that they are his real family. Based on classic characters created by A.A. Milne. This animated feature length film is filled with the songs, colour and movement that young children adore.

results.title: In America
results.creator_credit: Jim Sheridan, Arthur Lappin, Hell's Kitchen and Fox Searchlight
results.brief_description: From the director of “My Left Foot” and “In the name of the Father” comes a moving portrait of an Irish immigrant family trying to establish a new life in the US after a devastating tragedy. The father (Paddy Considine) is a struggling actor who ends up driving a taxi at night to make a living while the mother (Samantha Morton) raises their two adorable girls (played by real life sisters Sarah and Emma Bolger) while working at a nearby ice-cream parlour. The eldest of the two girls uses her home video camera as a way to document their current life and deal with the past - much of the strength and delight of the film comes from the roles of the children. Set in New York City in a dilapidated apartment building they share with drug dealers, pimps and other poor families, the girls be-friend a neighbour Mateo (Djimon Hounsou) who provides the family with a new outlook and helps them face their grief, while he deals with his own mortality. The loosely autobiographical script is based on Jim Sheridan’s life and was co-written with his two daughters Naomi and Kirsten Sherdian. Nominated for three Academy Awards in 2003.

results.title: Punch-drunk love = Punch drunk love
results.creator_credit: Paul Thomas Anderson, Daniel Lupi, Joanne Sellar, New Line Cinema, Revolution Studios and Columbia
results.brief_description: This is not a typical Adam Sandler comedy. Barry Egan (Sandler) is a novelty business owner who has seven sisters and is looking for love, (even trying phone sex once) but love finds him, sending his very ordered life upside down. Watching “Punch-drunk love” you find a mix of dark humour and seedy characters, coupled with violent behaviour and social dysfunction - but it’s also a romance with colour, mood and music that carries you along and makes you hope for a happy ending. Written and directed by Paul Thomas Anderson, winner of Best Director 2002 Cannes Film Festival for this disquieting film. Cast includes Emily Watson, Philip Seymour Hoffman and Luis Guzman.

results.title: Walking on Water
results.creator_credit: Tony Ayres, Liz Watts and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: An impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family.

constellations_other.name: Tony Ayres
constellations_other.description: Charts the acclaimed career of Tony Ayres through his work in film and TV.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Tony Ayres, Liz Watts and SBS Independent
results.description: Impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family. Gavin is a gay man living in Sydney when he succumbs to illness; his two best friends, Anna and Charlie, who assist his death in its final stages, grieve inconsolably, blocking their pain and memories with drugs, alcohol and sex. Whilst Charlie’s relationship with his boyfriend sours, Anna embarks on an affair, whilst shifting into controlling over-drive. This puts her in conflict with Gavin’s mother, who finds her role usurped. Despite the morbid subject matter “Walking on water” relishes in gallows humour, showing that even in death, there is life. Brilliant central performances from Vince Colosimo and Maria Theodorakis, coupled with intelligent scripting make this a memorable experience.
description_for_label: Impressive Australian debut feature from Tony Ayres about a young man’s death and the aftermath for his friends and family. results.title: Secretary
results.creator_credit: Steven Shainberg, Amy Hobby, Andrew Fierberg, Double A Films and Lions Gate Films
results.brief_description: A secretarial role at a law firm is a first job for a young girl with expert typing skills and having just left a hostel for people with mental illness, the girl also has a troubled home life and a history of self-mutilation. A look at contemporary sexual politics where ‘coming out’ has new meaning. The secretary, Lee Holloway (Maggie Gyllenhaal), reveals to her family and friends the need for her masochistic relationship with her boss E. Edward Grey (James Spader) and their special kind of love. The kind of office politics this film contains would horrify any Human Resources department! Based on the story “Secretary” by Mary Gaitskill. Cast includes Jeremy Davies. Contains Sex Scenes.
